title: Borders
text: default border_colour argument set NULL, interpreted CSS value "inherit". However, can override set card label colour manually. border_colour argument accept valid colour string recognised R. input can either single colour vector assigning card different border colour:

title: Borders
text: border_radius argument used control degree rounding card borders, integer 0 5. border_radius = 0 cards perfectly rectangular, rounding : roundest setting border_radius = 5 produces noticeably rounded rectangles:
code: galleries[1:3, ] %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     image = image_url,      border_radius = 0,   ) galleries[1:3, ] %>%    cards(     title = long_name,     image = image_url,      border_radius = 5,   )

title: Borders
text: Additional border customisation possible, passing character strings border_width border_width. character input used, cards() function passes input directly CSS. example, can create cards circular images thick borders like :

title: Builds a deck of bootstrap cards — cards
text: function constructs HTML necessary specify deck bootstrap 4 cards suitable inclusion within R markdown document. takes data frame first argument, one row card generated. Cards specified using title, text, image, link, footer, header, tags arguments. arguments take expressions evaluated using user-supplied data, evaluate character vectors length 1 number rows data. layout argument single character string specifying layout cards: possible values "label-" (default), "label-", "label-left", "label-right", "label-", "image-", "inset-top", "inset-bottom". width, spacing, breakpoint, border_width, border_radius arguments take integer inputs specifying visual appearance cards. Allowed values range 0 5, except width breakpoint 0. two arguments label_colour border_colour take single string specifying colours relevant parts card.
